item.title: A Database of Digital News in Fifteen African Countries
National Women's Conference
Hiring
item.description:
Position Title: Postdoctoral Fellow or Research Assistant Professor in Data Science

Location: University of Houston, Houston, TX, 77204

Salary range: $50K to $60K (depending on experience and qualifications) Health benefits: Yes

Position Description: A Research Assistant Professor position is available in the laboratory of Assistant Professor Peggy Lindner in the Department of Information & Logistics Technology (ILT). We are seeking a proactive and collaborative data and information scientist to conduct research centered around:

  • bringing modeling and computer simulation of social processes together with technology, experimental, and data-driven work;
  • combining the perspectives of different scientific disciplines (e.g., social science, computer science, complexity science);
  • bridging fundamental and applied work;
  • developing digital tools to support people and studying the resulting behavior.

The ILT department is collaborative and will provide a supportive training environment with opportunity to mentor undergraduates, develop new methods and expand scientific writing/communication skills.

Job Requirements

The candidate should have an excellent research background in computer science, computational social science, or data mining, with a strong publication track record. The minimum requirement is an earned doctorate in Data Science, Information Science, Computer Science, or other related fields at the time of appointment. Candidates will demonstrate evidence of effective teaching in the broad areas of Computer Science and Information Science.

Excellent scientific and computational skills, English language skills, social skills, and ability to identify significant and relevant research questions; familiarity with multiple research methodologies; ability to work on interdisciplinary and multidisciplinary research projects; effective presentation and written and verbal communication skills; experience preparing, creating, and/or presenting published work.

You are required to submit: Resume, list of publications, nmae and contact information for 3 references, transcript and three best publications (journal papers or peer-reviewed conference papers in international conferences). Please send your application directly to plindner-At-uh.edu

Job interviews are expected to take place mainly in May 2021. The position would start on September 1st, 2021.

item.description: A comprehensive collection of ~5600 academic scholars across 65 STEM departments at Universities across the US. We manually extraced data from department websites and augmented with automatically scraped publication data from Google Scholar.
